pullrequest.title: Allow world with a name other than "default". Fixed all tests.

content.raw:
I just noticed a small mistake in my logic for that script. As written it will include the wrong console out if test_ran fails. Here's a fix:
~~~
diff -r 12ea2cfb6dd6 tools/gz_build_test.bash
--- a/tools/gz_build_test.bash	Thu Apr 11 09:27:41 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/gz_build_test.bash	Thu Apr 11 10:31:49 2013 -0700
@@ -62,8 +62,8 @@
       echo Try $i of 100, failed test $f >> $logfileVerbose
       # then send the raw output of both the test and its companion test_ran
       # to the logfile for perusal
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
     done
   done
 
~~~
content.html:
I just noticed a small mistake in my logic for that script. As written it will include the wrong console out if test_ran fails. Here's a fix:

diff -r 12ea2cfb6dd6 tools/gz_build_test.bash
--- a/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 09:27:41 2013 -0700
+++ b/tools/gz_build_test.bash  Thu Apr 11 10:31:49 2013 -0700
@@ -62,8 +62,8 @@
       echo Try $i of 100, failed test $f >> $logfileVerbose
       # then send the raw output of both the test and its companion test_ran
       # to the logfile for perusal
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
-      grep '^ *'`echo "($f/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+1" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
+      grep '^ *'`echo "(($f-1)/2)*2+2" | bc`':' $logfileRaw >> $logfileVerbose
     done
   done
